Package it.polimi.ingsw.client

Class ConnectionSocket

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.ConnectionSocket
public class ConnectionSocket
extends java.lang.Object
This class handles the connection between the client and the server.
Author:
Luca Pirovano

  • Method Details

    • setup

      public void setup​(java.lang.String nickname, ModelView modelView, ActionHandler actionHandler) throws DuplicateNicknameException, InvalidNicknameException
      Initializes a new socket connection and handles the nickname-choice response. It loops until the server confirms the successful connection (with no nickname duplication and with a correctly configured match lobby).
      Parameters:
      nickname - the username chosen by the user.
      modelView - the game model.
      Throws:
      DuplicateNicknameException - if the selected nickname has already been taken (case-insensitive).
      InvalidNicknameException

    • readInput

      private boolean readInput​(java.lang.String nickname, java.io.ObjectInputStream input) throws DuplicateNicknameException, InvalidNicknameException
      Handles the input reading, in order to reduce the setup complexity.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the chosen nickname.
      input - the input socket stream.
      Returns:
      true if nickname is available and set, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      DuplicateNicknameException - if the nickname has already been chosen.
      InvalidNicknameException - if the nickname contains forbidden characters (like "-").

    • nicknameChecker

      public boolean nicknameChecker​(java.lang.Object input) throws DuplicateNicknameException, InvalidNicknameException
      Handles the nickname validation phase, after the server answer about the availability of the desired username.
      Parameters:
      input - the server ObjectStream answer.
      Returns:
      true if the nickname is available and set, false instead.
      Throws:
      DuplicateNicknameException - if the nickname has already been chosen.
      InvalidNicknameException

    • send

      public void send​(Message message)
      This method handles the sending of a new message to the server. It encapsulates the object in a SerializedMessage type, which will be unpacked and read by the server.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to be sent to the server.

    • send

      public void send​(UserAction action)
      This method handles the sending of a new action to the server. It encapsulates the object in a SerializedMessage type, which will be unpacked and read by the server.
      Parameters:
      action - the action to be sent to the server.
